climbs.name: Stud Muffin
climbs.fa: Mike Rigney and Dave Walters, June 1992

content.description: Climbs a striking crack splitting a block and after the good bit wanders up jumbled ledges to the top. Gear belay and walk-off.
content.location: Located on the east face and visible on the approach if coming past the Toprope Wall.

content.description: A fun easy crack starting from the seasonal stream.
content.location:
Located 20 feet right of

Humpback Arete

.

content.description: Climb a short section of slab past a right-facing corner to reach a small roof (crux) which is pulled on decent edges with poor feet. Above the roof easier moves on somewhat dirty rock gain a large ledge with anchors.
content.location: The center of three bolted routes on the northwest face.

Starts five feet right of

Glorious Gardens

.

climbs.name: Glorious Gardens
climbs.fa: John Cardmon and Brad Singer, July 1998

climbs.name: Aeroperro
climbs.fa: Mike Rigney, Brad Singer and John Cardmon, June 1998

content.description:
Fun climbing along a bulging, intermittent crack/seam leads over a small roof and finishes up interesting face to anchors on a broad ledge.

The climb was orignally done by finishing up and right via a dirty handcrack to anchors at the summit of the formation; rarely does anyone bother with this extra 15' of climbing, but it's there if you feel the need.
content.location:
Near the center of the northwest face and immediately right of

Mile High Club

.

content.description:
Starts on the left side of the main face 5' left of

Mile High Club

and then works left around the rounded arete slightly as you utilize holds on both sides of the arete before finishing back on the main face. Technical and interesting movement that make it seem longer than it is.
content.location:
On the rounded arete just left of

Mile High Club

.
